summary: This is a cover email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan, transmitting a letter from MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) legal counsel regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The email notes the letter is not filed on ECF but the government has no objection to its public docketing.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan for her review of an attached letter from MDC legal counsel regarding the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: MDC Legal Counsel
persons.context: Author of the attached letter regarding the case US v. Maxwell, which is being transmitted to Judge Nathan for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email transmitting the MDC legal counsel's letter to Judge Nathan for the case US v. Maxwell.

connections.description: The prosecutor is submitting correspondence to Judge Nathan for her review in the case US v. Maxwell.
The MDC legal counsel has written a letter addressed to Judge Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of MDC Counsel Letter
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney transmits a letter from MDC legal counsel to Judge Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a cover email dated December 4, 2020, from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan.
It transmits a letter from MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) legal counsel regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The MDC is not a party to the case, so the letter was not filed on the Electronic Case Filing (ECF) system.
The government has no objection to the letter being docketed publicly.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and communication regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's detention or related matters at the MDC.
